primary_contest.tagline: How good are your coding skills?

track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description: Solve algorithmic coding challenges and see how you measure up against some of the best programmers on the planet. You’ll have 48 hours to solve 8 challenges. Top 100 win shirts and cash prizes. Top performers will be introduced to sponsoring companies looking to hire. See you on the leaderboard!

    rObstacle,cObstacle = input().strip().split(' ')
    rObstacle,cObstacle = [int(rObstacle),int(cObstacle)]

model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n,k = gets.strip.split(' ')
n = n.to_i
k = k.to_i
rQueen,cQueen = gets.strip.split(' ')
rQueen = rQueen.to_i
cQueen = cQueen.to_i
for a0 in (0..k-1)
    rObstacle,cObstacle = gets.strip.split(' ')
    rObstacle = rObstacle.to_i
    cObstacle = cObstacle.to_i
    # your code goes here
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let k = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    rqueen_temp <- getLine
    let rqueen_t = words rqueen_temp
    let rqueen = read $ rqueen_t!!0 :: Int
    let cqueen = read $ rqueen_t!!1 :: Int
    forM_ [1..k] $ \a0  -> do
        robstacle_temp <- getLine
        let robstacle_t = words robstacle_temp
        let robstacle = read $ robstacle_t!!0 :: Int
        let cobstacle = read $ robstacle_t!!1 :: Int
        -- your code goes here


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Find the number of squares the queen can attack.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_temp (read-line) 
          n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
          n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
          k (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          rQueen_temp (read-line) 
          rQueen_t (split rQueen_temp #"\s+") 
          rQueen (Integer/parseInt (rQueen_t 0)) 
          cQueen (Integer/parseInt (rQueen_t 1)) 
        ]
      )

      (
        loop [a0 k]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              rObstacle_temp (read-line) 
              rObstacle_t (split rObstacle_temp #"\s+") 
              rObstacle (Integer/parseInt (rObstacle_t 0)) 
              cObstacle (Integer/parseInt (rObstacle_t 1)) 
            ]
          )

        ; your code goes here
        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,K]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    { ok, [Rqueen,Cqueen]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    K_list = lists:seq(1,K),
    lists:foreach( fun(K0) ->
            { ok, [Robstacle,Cobstacle]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
            % your code goes here
    end,K_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
